cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the northern Caribbean, then turning northwest toward the Bahamas and the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watches in effect for Cuba (Matanzas eastward) and the central Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings for northern Leeward Islands, U.S./British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, northern Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, and southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Caribbean islands, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and the southeast U.S. coast from Florida northward
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are 70 % likely; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if Irma tracks close to the east coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Long-duration onshore flow could drive surf and storm surge over 3 ft along the Space Coast, especially if Irma parallels the shoreline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4â€“8 inches of rain possible with higher isolated totals, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous rip currents, port access channel closures and possible coastal erosion.
